general.title: General Information
general.p1: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you use Varbe. Personal data is any data that can be used to personally identify you.
general.p2: We take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy. Varbe only collects data that is absolutely necessary for the operation of the platform. We do not sell data to third parties and do not use invasive tracking technologies.

currentItems.account: Account data upon registration (email, encrypted password, username)
currentItems.profile: Profile information (bio, artist name, profile picture, location optional)
currentItems.usage: Usage behavior (likes, follows, comments, chat messages)
currentItems.technical: Technical data (IP address, browser type, device)

futureItems.marketplace: Marketplace data (transactions, shipping addresses, payment information via Stripe)
futureItems.location: Location data (only when you use Local Art Radar and grant permission)

howWeUse.title: How do we use your data?

items.platform: Provision and operation of the platform
items.personalization: Personalization of the Discovery Feed (when active)
items.improvement: Improving the platform through usage analysis

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.intro: You have the right at any time to:

items.complaint: Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

s2.title: 2. Responsible Party
s2.intro: The party responsible for data processing on this website is:
s2.responsibility: The responsible party decides alone or jointly with others on the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g., names, email addresses, etc.).

s3.title: 3. Hosting and Technical Infrastructure

firebase.intro: Varbe is hosted on Firebase (Google Cloud Platform). The provider is:
firebase.processing: When you use Varbe, Firebase collects various log files including your IP address. This is technically necessary for the operation of the website. Firebase processes data on our behalf and is bound by a data processing agreement (DPA).
firebase.usaTransferText: Google is certified under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework. Data transfer to the USA is based on Standard Contractual Clauses of the EU Commission.
firebase.legalBasisText: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in reliable hosting)

s3.firestore: We use Cloud Firestore from Firebase to store user data, profiles, artworks, comments, and other content structures. The data is stored encrypted and is subject to Firebase's privacy policy.
s3.storage: Uploaded images and media are stored in Firebase Storage. The data is encrypted during transmission and storage.

registration.title: 4.1 Registration and Account Creation
registration.intro: When you register with Varbe, we collect the following data:

requiredItems.password: Password (stored encrypted, never in plain text)

registration.storageDurationText: Until account deletion or upon your request

auth.title: 4.2 Firebase Authentication
auth.intro: We use Firebase Authentication for user authentication. Firebase stores:

items.timestamps: Timestamps of registration and last login

auth.socialLogin: When using Social Login (Google OAuth, if implemented), additional profile data provided by the provider (name, profile picture) is collected.

verification.title: 4.3 Artist Verification
verification.intro: During artist verification, we additionally collect:

items.details: Information about technique, style, previous exhibitions

verification.review: This data is manually reviewed by our team and partially deleted after verification (only relevant profile information is retained).
verification.legalBasisText: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (contract performance) and Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in an AI-free platform)

content.title: 4.4 Content (Artworks, Posts, Comments)
content.intro: When you upload content to Varbe, we store:
content.visibilityText: All uploaded artworks and posts are publicly visible by default. Comments are linked to your profile and public.

usage.title: 4.5 Usage Behavior and Interactions
usage.intro: We collect your usage behavior to improve the platform and personalize the Discovery Feed:

items.swipes: Swipe behavior in Discovery Feed (when active)

usage.purpose: This data is used to show you relevant content and generate recommendations.
usage.legalBasisText: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in a personalized user experience)
usage.optOut: You can object to personalization at info@varbe.org. In this case, you will receive non-personalized content.

chat.title: 4.6 Chat and Direct Messages
chat.intro: Messages in chat areas and Direct Messages (when active) are stored to enable communication. We do not read your messages except in cases of reported violations of community guidelines.
chat.storageDurationText: Messages are stored until you delete them or close your account.

s5.title: 5. Future Features and Data Processing
s5.notice: The following data processing will only take effect when the corresponding features are active. You will be notified by email in advance.

discovery.title: 5.1 Discovery Feed Personalization
discovery.intro: Once the Discovery Feed goes live, we will analyze your usage behavior in more detail:

items.stories: Interaction with Stories (listening to Voice Notes, watching Process Videos)

discovery.purpose: This data is used to personalize the "For You" feed. You can switch to non-personalized feeds at any time.

local.title: 5.2 Local Art Radar
local.intro: If you want to use the Local Art Radar, we need your location data:

items.current: Current location (GPS coordinates, only during active use)

local.important: Important: Location data is only collected if you explicitly grant permission and actively use the feature. You can revoke permission at any time in your device settings.

marketplace.title: 5.3 Marketplace and Payments
marketplace.intro: Once the Marketplace is active, we additionally process:

sellerItems.stripe: Stripe Connect account data (bank details, tax ID)

buyerItems.payment: Payment information (only via Stripe, we do not store credit card data)

marketplace.stripeText: All payments are processed by Stripe Inc. Stripe processes credit card data and payment information. We only receive confirmations of successful payments, never your complete credit card data.
marketplace.storageDurationText: Transaction data is stored according to legal retention periods (10 years for tax purposes).

cookies.title: 6.1 Cookies
cookies.intro: Varbe uses cookies to ensure the functionality of the website. Cookies are small text files stored on your device.
cookies.necessaryNote: These cookies are essential for the operation of the website and are set without your consent.
cookies.analyticsText: We may use Google Analytics or similar tools to analyze user behavior. These cookies are only set if you consent.
cookies.management: You can manage or delete cookies in your browser settings. Disabling cookies may limit the functionality of the website.

analytics.title: 6.2 Tracking and Analytics
analytics.firebaseText: We use Firebase Analytics to obtain aggregated statistics about platform usage (e.g., number of users, popular features, error reports). The data is collected anonymously.
analytics.ipAnonymizationText: IP addresses are truncated so that no tracing to individual users is possible.
analytics.legalBasisText: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in improving the platform)
analytics.objectionText: You can object to analysis at info@varbe.org.

noTrackers.title: 6.3 No Invasive Trackers
noTrackers.respect: We respect your privacy and only use the minimally necessary tracking technologies.

s7.title: 7. Data Sharing with Third Parties
s7.intro: We do not share your personal data with third parties, except:

processors.title: 7.1 Data Processors

items.firebase: Google Firebase / Google Cloud Platform (hosting, database)
items.stripe: Stripe (payment processing, only for Marketplace usage)

processors.note: These service providers process data exclusively on our behalf and are bound by data processing agreements (DPA).

legal.title: 7.2 Legal Obligations
legal.text: We may disclose data if we are legally obligated to do so (e.g., official requests, court orders) or to enforce our rights.

merger.title: 7.3 Sale or Merger
merger.text: In the event of a sale or merger of Varbe, your data may be transferred to the acquirer. You will be notified in advance.

s8.title: 8. Data Transfer to Third Countries
s8.text1: By using Google Firebase, data may be transferred to the USA. Google is certified under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework, which ensures an adequate level of data protection.
s8.text2: Additionally, we use Standard Contractual Clauses of the EU Commission as the legal basis for data transfer.

s9.title: 9. Data Security
s9.intro: We implement technical and organizational measures to protect your data:

items.ssl: SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmissions
items.firewall: Firewall and access restrictions on Firebase

items.access: Access to data only for authorized employees
items.assessments: Data protection impact assessments for new features
items.incident: Incident response plan for security incidents

s9.disclaimer: Despite all security measures, no data transmission over the Internet can be 100% secure. You use Varbe at your own risk.

s10.title: 10. Storage Duration
s10.intro: We only store your data for as long as necessary for the respective purposes:

items.contentText: Until you delete them or close your account
items.commentsText: Anonymized upon account deletion but not deleted (to preserve discussions)
items.transactionsText: 10 years (legal retention period for tax purposes)

s11.title: 11. Your Rights as a Data Subject
s11.intro: Under the GDPR, you have the following rights:

access.title: 11.1 Right to Access (Art. 15 GDPR)
access.intro: You can request information about your stored personal data at any time. The information is free of charge and includes:

items.what: What data is stored about you
items.purpose: For what purposes the data is processed
items.recipients: To whom the data has been disclosed
items.duration: How long the data will be stored

correction.title: 11.2 Right to Rectification (Art. 16 GDPR)
correction.text: You can request the correction of inaccurate data. Most profile data can be corrected by yourself in your account settings.

deletion.title: 11.3 Right to Erasure (Art. 17 GDPR)
deletion.intro: You can request the deletion of your data ("right to be forgotten"). We will delete your data if:

items.noLongerNeeded: The data is no longer needed for the original purposes
items.consent: You withdraw your consent (for consent-based processing)
items.objection: You object and there are no overriding legitimate grounds for processing

deletion.exceptionsText: We may refuse deletion if legal retention periods apply (e.g., transaction data) or the data is needed for legal proceedings.
deletion.accountDeletionText: We will delete all your data within 30 days.

restriction.title: 11.4 Right to Restriction of Processing (Art. 18 GDPR)
restriction.intro: You can request restriction of processing if:

items.accuracy: The accuracy of the data is contested
items.unlawful: The processing is unlawful but you do not want deletion
items.legal: The data is no longer needed but you need it for legal claims

portability.title: 11.5 Right to Data Portability (Art. 20 GDPR)
portability.text: You can receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format and have it transferred to another provider.
portability.format: We will provide your data in JSON or CSV format.

objection.title: 11.6 Right to Object (Art. 21 GDPR)
objection.text: You can object to the processing of your data based on legitimate interests (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) at any time. We will stop processing unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds.
objection.specialText: You can object to the personalization of the Discovery Feed at any time.

withdrawal.title: 11.7 Right to Withdraw Consent (Art. 7(3) GDPR)
withdrawal.text: If processing is based on your consent (e.g., analytics cookies, location data), you can withdraw it at any time. The lawfulness of processing carried out before the withdrawal remains unaffected.

s12.title: 12. Right to Complain to Supervisory Authority
s12.intro: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority if you believe that the processing of your data is unlawful.

s13.title: 13. Changes to This Privacy Policy
s13.text1: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy to comply with changed legal requirements or changes to our services.
s13.text2: For significant changes, registered users will be notified by email (at least 14 days before entry into force). The current version is always available at varbe.org/datenschutz.
s13.recommendationText: Visit this page regularly to stay informed about changes.

s14.title: 14. Privacy Contact
s14.intro: For questions about data protection or to exercise your rights:
s14.subject: Subject

s15.title: 15. SSL/TLS Encryption
s15.text1: This website uses SSL/TLS encryption for security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the browser address bar changing from "http://" to "https://" and the lock symbol in your browser bar.
s15.text2: When SSL/TLS encryption is activated, the data you transmit to us cannot be read by third parties.

whatAreCookies.title: What are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.text1: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer or mobile device by websites when you visit them. They are used to make websites functional, more efficient, and to enable certain features.
whatAreCookies.text2: Cookies cannot be used to run programs or transfer viruses to your computer. They are not harmful to you as a user but help websites run smoothly and prevent you from having to log in again with every visit.

philosophy.title: Our Cookie Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: Transparency and Minimalism:
philosophy.text: Varbe only uses cookies that are absolutely necessary for the operation of the platform or that significantly improve your user experience. We don't believe in invasive tracking or aggressive marketing cookies. Your privacy is important to us.

howWeUse.title: How does Varbe use Cookies?
howWeUse.intro: We use different types of cookies for different purposes:

necessary.title: 1. Necessary Cookies (Essential)
necessary.note: These cookies are essential for the website to function and are set without your consent.
necessary.intro: These cookies enable basic functions such as security, authentication, and network management. Without these cookies, Varbe would not work. You cannot disable these cookies without significantly affecting the functionality of the website.

items.session: Session cookies so you stay logged in
items.userId: User ID for associating your content

items.csrf: CSRF token for protection against Cross-Site Request Forgery

items.consent: Cookie consent status (so we don't ask you constantly)

necessary.legalBasisText: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in operating the website)
necessary.storageDurationText: Session cookies: until browser is closed; Persistent cookies: maximum 30 days

functional.title: 2. Functional Cookies (Optional)
functional.note: These cookies enable enhanced features and are only set with your consent.
functional.intro: Functional cookies remember your preferences and make using Varbe more comfortable. They are not strictly necessary but significantly improve your user experience.

items.filters: Filter preferences in Discovery Feed (when active)

items.feedPosition: Feed position (so you can continue where you left off)
items.feedModes: Preferred feed modes (For You, Following, Local, Explore)

functional.control: You can disable these cookies in the cookie settings.

analytics.title: 3. Analytical Cookies (Optional)
analytics.note: These cookies help us improve Varbe and are only set with your consent.
analytics.intro: Analytical cookies collect anonymized information about how visitors use our website. This data helps us identify problems, improve user experience, and develop new features.

items.noTracking: No tracing to individual users possible
items.aggregated: Data is only used in aggregated and anonymized form

analytics.objectionText: You can object to analysis at any time at info@varbe.org or in the cookie settings.

marketing.title: 4. Marketing Cookies
marketing.noMarketing: We currently DO NOT use any marketing cookies.
marketing.intro: Varbe does not use invasive marketing or remarketing cookies. We believe in organic growth and respect your privacy. There are:

notUsed.tracking: No behavioral tracking across multiple websites
notUsed.ads: No personalized ads based on your browsing
notUsed.socialPixels: No social media pixels (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok)
notUsed.remarketing: No remarketing campaigns that follow you

socialSharing.title: Social Media Sharing (optional)
socialSharing.text: If you want to share content on social media, connections to these platforms are only established when you actively click the "Share" button. There are no passive social media trackers on Varbe.

future.title: Future (with your consent)
future.text: If we use limited marketing cookies in the future (e.g., for targeted artist acquisition campaigns), you will be informed in advance and asked for explicit consent.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.intro: Some cookies are set by third-party providers whose services we use to operate Varbe. These providers process data on our behalf and are bound by data processing agreements.

firebase.cookies: Firebase Authentication Cookies, Firebase Session Cookies, Firebase Analytics Cookies (consent only)

stripe.cookies: Stripe Session Cookies, Fraud Detection Cookies
stripe.note: Important: Stripe cookies are only set when you start the checkout process. No Stripe cookies are set when browsing Varbe normally.

manage.title: How can you manage Cookies?
manage.intro: You have full control over the use of cookies on Varbe.

option1.title: Option 1: Cookie Banner (on first visit)
option1.text: On your first visit to Varbe, a cookie banner appears where you can choose:
option1.acceptAllDesc: All cookies are set (necessary + functional + analytical)

q1.question: Why does Varbe use cookies at all?
q1.answer: Cookies are necessary for you to log in and stay logged in. Without cookies, you would have to log in again with every page view, which would be very impractical.

q2.question: Does Varbe sell my cookie data?
q2.answer: No, never. We do not sell any data to third parties. We only use cookies to make Varbe better for you.

q3.question: Can I use Varbe without cookies?
q3.answer: The website requires at least the necessary cookies for authentication and session management. All other cookies are optional.

q4.question: Are my likes and follows tracked?
q4.answer: Your interactions (likes, follows, comments) are stored to personalize the Discovery Feed ‚Äì but these are not "cookies", they are data in your account. You can object to personalization at any time.

q5.question: What's the difference from Instagram/Facebook?
q5.answer: Instagram and Facebook use aggressive tracking cookies that follow you across many websites and use them for targeted advertising. Varbe doesn't do that. We only track what happens on our own platform and don't use the data for advertising.

general.title: General
general.a1: Varbe is an online marketplace for authentic artworks. We connect artists directly with art lovers and offer fair prices, secure payments, and buyer protection.
general.a2: Artists can list their works on Varbe after verification. Buyers can purchase artworks or bid in auctions. All payments are processed securely via Stripe.
general.a3: Varbe is completely free for buyers. Artists pay a fee of 10% (max. ‚Ç¨10) per sale. No monthly fees or hidden costs.

buying.title: Buying
buying.q1: How do I buy an artwork?
buying.a1: Browse our categories or use the search function. Click on an artwork for details and then click 'Buy Now'. Pay securely via Stripe (credit card, PayPal).
buying.a2: We accept credit cards, SEPA direct debit, instant transfer, and PayPal - all processed securely via Stripe.
buying.a3: Yes! You have 14 days buyer protection from delivery. If something is wrong, you can file a complaint and get your money back.
buying.a4: Artists must ship within 5 business days after payment. The exact delivery time depends on the shipping provider and is shown in the listing.

selling.title: Selling
selling.q1: How do I become an artist on Varbe?
selling.a1: Register, submit a verification application with at least 3 sample works, and wait for manual review by our team. After verification, you can start selling immediately.
selling.q2: What does it cost to sell on Varbe?
selling.a2: Varbe charges a 10% fee per sale (max. ‚Ç¨10). Additionally, Stripe fees apply (1.5% + ‚Ç¨0.25). No monthly fees or registration fees.
selling.q3: How do I receive my money?
selling.a3: After a successful sale, your money is released after 14 days buyer protection. Payouts are made automatically on the 15th of each month to your bank account (via Stripe Connect).
selling.q4: Do I need to set up Stripe Connect?
selling.a4: Yes, to receive payouts, you need to set up Stripe Connect. This takes only a few minutes and is free. You'll be guided through the onboarding process automatically.

payment.title: Payments & Payouts
payment.q1: When do I receive my money as an artist?
payment.a1: Your money is released after 14 days buyer protection and automatically paid out on the 15th of the next month to your bank account (if at least ‚Ç¨10 is available).
payment.q2: How much money do I receive per sale?
payment.a2: You receive the sale price minus Varbe fee (10%, max. ‚Ç¨10) and Stripe fees (1.5% + ‚Ç¨0.25). Example: For a ‚Ç¨100 sale, you receive approximately ‚Ç¨88.25.
payment.a3: Yes, payouts are completely free. No additional fees apply.

shipping.title: Shipping
shipping.a1: The buyer pays the shipping costs indicated in the listing. Artists can also offer free shipping.
shipping.a2: Artists ship independently with a shipping provider of their choice (DHL, Hermes, DPD, etc.). The tracking number is automatically validated and communicated to the buyer.
shipping.q3: What happens if the package doesn't arrive?
shipping.a3: If the package doesn't arrive within 30 days or is damaged, you can file a complaint. Our support team reviews the case and refunds money for justified complaints.

malerei.seoText2: On Varbe you'll find original paintings in various techniques: acrylic painting for modern, vibrant works, oil painting for classic, timeless pieces, and watercolor for delicate, transparent compositions.

ueberUns.title: About Varbe
ueberUns.tagline: By artists, for artists. The social platform for real art.
ueberUns.intro: Varbe will be the first Art Discovery Platform that truly unites Social Media and Marketplace. While Instagram suffocates artists with algorithms, DeviantArt gets flooded with AI garbage, and Etsy takes 35-40% fees, we're building something different: A platform where you can swipe through artworks like on TikTok, discover local artists near you, and buy directly from the artist. Completely AI-free, fair with only 10% fees, and without algorithm manipulation.
ueberUns.earlyAccess: We're currently in Early Access. This means the big launch with Discovery Feed, Marketplace, and all features is coming in the next months. But you can already be part of it, connect with other artists and art lovers in our chat areas, and actively shape the platform. As a founding member, you're in from the start and get special benefits like a "Founding Member" badge and reduced fees when the Marketplace goes live.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.subtitle: Making art discoverable. Making artists visible.
mission.text1: We founded Varbe in 2024 in Bremen because we were simply frustrated as artists and art lovers. As artists, we see only 5% of our followers reached on Instagram. Our posts disappear in the algorithm while AI-generated "art" goes viral. We post something that took us weeks of work and get three likes. Meanwhile, Etsy takes 35-40% fees and DeviantArt gets flooded with AI spam.
mission.text2: As buyers, it's become impossible to find real originals. You scroll through hundreds of AI-generated images before you see a real artwork. And when you find one, you either pay horrendous gallery markups or don't know if the seller is legitimate.
mission.text3: We believe art discovery should be an experience, not a fight against algorithms. That's why we're building Varbe ‚Äì a platform that combines the best of social media (Discovery, Community, Stories) with the best of marketplaces (direct sales, fair prices, buyer protection). And most importantly: We work for artists, not against them.

discovery.title: Discover art like on TikTok
discovery.text1: Imagine scrolling through Instagram or TikTok ‚Äì but instead of Reels, you see stunning artworks in full screen. That's exactly how our Discovery Feed will work. Swipe up for the next piece, double-tap to like, and get inspired by real art instead of being manipulated by algorithms.
discovery.text2: The feed will be personalized, but without the games Instagram plays. When you follow an artist, you actually see their posts. No shadow bans, no artificial reach throttling, no "post daily or die" culture. Your Following feed is chronological, honest, and transparent. You can work at your own pace and don't have to worry about your reach dropping if you take a week off.

stories.title: Every artwork tells a story
stories.text1: An artwork is more than just a pretty picture. Behind every piece is a process, an inspiration, a story. That's why artists on Varbe can record voice notes for each work ‚Äì 30 seconds where they share how the piece was created, what it means, or which technique they used.
stories.text2: You'll be able to see behind-the-scenes process videos showing how a blank canvas became a finished artwork. Or read short text stories about the inspiration behind the piece. Art transforms from product to experience. You're not just buying an image, but a story, a connection to the artist, a piece of creative energy.

local.title: Find art near you
local.text1: Art doesn't just exist on screens. In your city, there are probably dozens of talented artists you've never discovered. Our Local Art Radar will show you on an interactive map where art is being created near you. You'll get notifications like "New art posted 500m away" and can discover local studios, Open Studio Events, and exhibitions.
local.text2: Maybe you live just two streets from a painter whose style you love. Maybe there's a ceramics studio in your neighborhood you've never noticed. The Local Art Radar brings the online and offline art world together. Because ultimately, it's not just about buying, but about getting to know the real people behind the art.

community.title: Community instead of just follower counts
community.text1: Yes, there will be followers on Varbe ‚Äì you can follow artists and they can follow you. But we don't believe success should be measured by follower counts. Instead, we're building features that create real connections instead of superficial engagement.
community.text2: Artist Circles will be small private groups of up to ten artists who support each other, give constructive feedback, and grow together. No public comments, no likes, just honest critique among like-minded people. This is where real friendships and accountability partnerships form.
community.text3: Our Weekly Art Challenges will bring the community together: A prompt is published, everyone has 48 hours to create something, and the community votes for their favorites. Winners get featured in the Main Feed and earn badges. It's not about posting daily or feeding the algorithm ‚Äì it's about quality over quantity.

aiFree.title: 100% AI-Free Zone
aiFree.text: We have zero tolerance for AI-generated art. Every artist is manually verified. We use AI detection on every upload. All real artists get a "Verified Human Artist" badge. If AI is suspected, there's immediate suspension and permanent ban. We protect our community uncompromisingly. Your art won't be mixed with AI garbage and won't disappear among thousands of AI-generated images.

fairFees.title: Fair conditions for artists
fairFees.text1: When our Marketplace goes live, we only take 10% fee per sale ‚Äì maximum ‚Ç¨10. No monthly fees, no listing fees, no hidden costs. In comparison: Etsy takes 35-40%, galleries often take 50%. With us, 90% of the money goes directly to you. Payout is automatic via Stripe Connect. Transparent, fair, honest.
fairFees.text2: But most importantly: You don't have to sell anything to be part of the community. Varbe is first and foremost a Discovery Platform. The Marketplace is optional. You can use Varbe to show your art, build a community, connect with other artists ‚Äì completely without sales pressure.

protection.title: Buyer protection and security
protection.text: Once the Marketplace launches, there's a 14-day money-back guarantee. Secure payment via Stripe. Tracking with every shipment. If there are problems: full purchase price back. You buy directly from the artist, not through intermediaries, but with the security you know from major platforms.

noAlgorithm.title: No algorithm hell
noAlgorithm.text: Your art, your control. The chronological feed for your followers shows everything you post. Featured Artists are curated, not "promoted". No shadow bans, no artificial reach throttling, no black-box algorithms. Transparent visibility. If you make good art and build a community, you'll be seen ‚Äì regardless of how often you post or whether you spend money on ads.

story.title: Our Story
story.text1: Varbe was founded in 2024 in Bremen by a team made up of artists and art lovers. We've experienced the frustration ourselves. We spent weeks on an artwork, posted it on Instagram, and got three likes while an AI-generated image went viral. We sold on Etsy and paid 40% fees. We tried to find real art on DeviantArt and had to scroll through hundreds of AI spam images.
story.text2: At the same time, we've seen how platforms like TikTok and Instagram find new ways to discover content. How local communities on Meetup and Discord create real connections. How Patreon and Gumroad enable artists to live directly from their community.
story.text3: We thought: Why isn't there a platform that combines all of this? A platform that makes art discovery as easy as TikTok but is as fair as Patreon. That connects local communities like Meetup but scales globally like Instagram. That consistently excludes AI and truly puts artists at the center.
story.text4: So we built Varbe. Or rather: We're building it right now. Because we don't want to do this alone. We want to build Varbe together with the community ‚Äì with artists who understand what's missing, and with art lovers who appreciate real art.

status.title: Current Status
status.intro: We're in Early Access. This means many features are still coming in the next months.
status.text1: The Discovery Feed is in development. The Marketplace is coming later. The Local Art Radar is being rolled out. But you can already be part of it.
status.text2: Currently you can create a profile, register and get verified as an artist, follow updates in our blog, and connect with other founding members in the chat areas. You're in from the start. You can give feedback that flows directly into development. You get a "Founding Member" badge. And when the Marketplace goes live, you'll benefit from reduced fees in the first months. We could develop for two more years and then do a "perfect" launch. But we believe in Community-First. We want to build Varbe together with the people we're building it for. That's why we're opening the doors now, even if not everything is finished yet.

discovery.title: Discovery Feed
discovery.text: The vertical full-screen feed will have four modes: "For You" shows personalized art based on your likes. "Following" shows everything chronologically from artists you follow. "Local" shows art from your city or region. "Explore" shows curated highlights from the community. You can switch between modes and get exactly the type of content you want to see.

profiles.title: Artist Profiles
profiles.text: Your profile will show a timeline view of your artistic development. You can create portfolio collections for curated series. A "Work in Progress" section shows what you're currently working on. Your Artist DNA Profile visualizes your style through tags, techniques, and influences. Other artists can visit your profile, follow you, nominate you for Circles, or challenge you to Challenges.

community.title: Community Features
community.text: Comments will be substantial ‚Äì no "cool" or "nice" one-worders. Minimum 15 characters so real conversations can happen. Artist Circles for private critique and support. Weekly Challenges for community engagement. A badge system that's not based on follower counts but on real participation. And Direct Messages once the chat system is rolled out.

marketplace.title: Marketplace
marketplace.text: When the Marketplace goes live, you can list artworks with just a few clicks. Set a price, specify shipping options, done. When sold, everything runs automatically: Payment via Stripe, notification to you, shipping with tracking, money release after buyer protection period, automatic payout on the 15th of the month. You don't have to worry about anything ‚Äì except packing and shipping your artwork.

join.title: Become part of the Varbe Community

artists.title: For Artists
artists.text: Create your profile for free now. Get verified and become part of the founding community. Connect with other artists in the chat areas. Give feedback on platform development. And be ready when the Discovery Feed and Marketplace go live ‚Äì then you can hit the ground running.
artists.benefits: As an Early Access member, you get the "Founding Member" badge, get featured preferentially, and receive reduced fees in the first months. You're not just a user, you're a co-creator.

lovers.title: For Art Lovers
lovers.text: Even if the Discovery Feed isn't live yet ‚Äì you can already become part of the community. Get to know the first artists. Follow the blog for updates. Join discussions in the chat areas. And be ready when Varbe fully launches ‚Äì then a world full of real, handmade art awaits you.

next.title: What's Next?
next.text: In the coming weeks and months, we'll be rolling out step by step: Discovery Feed Beta for first users. Artist Circles and Challenge system. Local Art Radar with interactive map. Marketplace for sales with buyer protection. Mobile app for iOS and Android. And much more, based on your feedback.
next.updates: We'll keep you updated via the blog and email. Every new feature will be announced and beta testers from the Early Access community get first access.

cta.slogan: Discover art. Support artists. No AI bullshit.

kuenstler.title: For Artists
kuenstler.heroTitle: Sell your art directly to art lovers ‚Äì fair, simple, transparent.

step1.title: Register & Verify
step1.desc: Create an account and get verified as an artist. Upload your portfolio and wait for confirmation.

step2.title: List Artworks
step2.desc: Create listings for your artworks. Add images, descriptions and prices. Choose between buy now or auction.

step3.title: Sell & Get Paid
step3.desc: Once an artwork is sold, you ship it. After 14 days of buyer protection, your money is paid out.

platform.title: Platform Fee: 10%
platform.desc: We only take 10% of the sale price. That means: 90% of the money goes directly to you!

payment.title: Payment Fees: ~3%
payment.desc: Stripe charges an additional ~3% for secure payment processing. This fee is displayed transparently.

hidden.title: No hidden costs
hidden.desc: No monthly fees, no listing fees, no payout fees. You only pay when you sell.

fair.title: ‚úÖ Fair Fees
fair.desc: 90% of the sale price goes to you. No hidden costs, no monthly fees.

simple.title: ‚úÖ Simple Process
simple.desc: Create listings in minutes. No complicated contracts or lengthy approval processes.

protection.title: ‚úÖ Buyer Protection
protection.desc: We handle buyer protection so you can focus on your art.

contact.title: ‚úÖ Direct Contact
contact.desc: Buyers can communicate directly with you. No anonymous intermediaries.

flexible.title: ‚úÖ Flexible Sales Options
flexible.desc: Choose between buy now, auction or both. You set the prices.

payout.title: ‚úÖ Fast Payout
payout.desc: After 14 days of buyer protection, your money is automatically paid out. No long waiting times.

kuenstler.verificationText1: To ensure the quality of our platform, we verify every artist manually.
kuenstler.verificationTimeText: Verification usually takes 1-3 business days. We review each portfolio personally to ensure only real art is sold on Varbe.
kuenstler.finalCtaText: Become part of the Varbe community and reach art lovers across Germany.

kaufen.title: Buy Art
kaufen.heroTitle: Discover unique artworks directly from independent artists.
kaufen.howTitle: How to buy art on Varbe

step1.title: Discover
step1.desc: Browse through hundreds of artworks from verified artists. Filter by category, style, price or technique.

step2.title: Buy
step2.desc: Choose between buy now or auction. Secure payment via Stripe. 14-day buyer protection included.

step3.title: Enjoy
step3.desc: Your artwork comes directly from the artist to your home. Or pick it up in person if possible.

guarantee.title: 14-Day Money-Back Guarantee
guarantee.desc: If you're not satisfied with your purchase, you can return the artwork within 14 days of receipt and get your money back.

secure.title: Secure Payment
secure.desc: All payments are processed via Stripe ‚Äì one of the world's most secure payment providers. Your credit card details are never stored with us.

verified.title: Verified Artists
verified.desc: Every artist on Varbe is manually verified. We review portfolios and ensure only real art is sold.

shipping.title: üì¶ Shipping
shipping.desc: Most artists ship within Germany and the EU. Shipping costs are shown in the listing.
shipping.time: Delivery time: Usually 5-14 business days after payment.

pickup.title: üìç Pickup
pickup.desc: Many artists also offer pickup. Perfect for local buyers or if you want to pick up the artwork in person.

digital.title: üíæ Digital Art
digital.desc: Digital artworks are provided as downloads immediately after purchase. No shipping needed!

packaging.title: üì¶ Packaging
packaging.desc: Artists ship artworks securely packaged. For larger works, insurance is often recommended.

card.title: üí≥ Credit Card
card.desc: Visa, Mastercard, American Express ‚Äì all common credit cards are accepted.

paypal.title: üîê PayPal
paypal.desc: Pay securely with PayPal ‚Äì if the artist accepts PayPal.

kaufen.paymentNote: All payments are securely processed via Stripe. Your data is protected.
kaufen.ctaText: Browse through hundreds of unique artworks from independent artists.
